choices.D: Configure two servers with the same IP address

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Round Robin DNS offers 'increased' availability, although has certain drawbacks. Same IP would cause conflicts

questions.question_text: A server administrator wants to increase the availability of a web server without implementing a cluster. Which of the following would accomplish this task?

An administrator is determining hardware requirements for a new, virtualized test environment. The vendor requires 8Gb of RAM for each host and 2Gb of RAM for each guest. If the server has a total of 32Gb of RAM, which of the following describes how many hosts and guests the server can support?

discussion.content: I think it might be that you only need 1 host to use a VM...
The math works out for three of the answers and obviously the 4/0 is out but don't understand why the answer it what it is.

questions.question_text: An administrator is installing a 2U server from a remote location in a rack with 4U of available rack space. The administrator prepares the rack to accept the server. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?

comments.content:
And some same brand 2U and 4U racks can use the same rail kits 
most server brands have few types of rail kits and able to share with different height of servers

discussion.content: There must be a sentence missing her right? The question does not make any sense

Selected Answer: B
the wording is terrible, however B appears correct: 2U equipped with own railing was brought from another location. It says admin prepares the rack, so it implies he has to do some work with that rack to accept the 2U. He prepares meaning nothing is broken, space is not an issue, cable management should not be an issue in this scenario. Mismatched rail kits is correct if to consider plural (kits) + remote location

questions.question_text:
A server supports a maximum of six hot-swap hard drives. It currently has four drives installed. The administrator has a bare hard drive on hand as a cold spare.
Which of the following parts would the administrator need to have to install the drive as a hot spare?

discussion.content:
You need except SATA cable and power cable to power that drive, and in question it says it has bare HDD.
More logical answer would be B Drive tray as correct answer.
What if the server is not HP?

questions.question_text: A physical server at a remote location has failed POST. A reboot of the server is required to fix the issue, but the systems administrator is unable to access the operating system. Which of the following tools should the administrator use to reboot the server?
